PIONEER EXPERIENCES

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use extra sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer all questions.

Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1947, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer:

- All questionnaires
- Pioneer diet
- Pioneer schools
- Pioneer churches
- Pioneer recreation and social life
- Pioneer farming experiences
- Folklore in Saskatchewan
- Pioneer health and housing

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent records of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Elliot M. North
2. Your address: Mayberry, Sask.
3. Date: January 1956
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Sproat Settlement, Canada, Ontario
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: John Robert
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): April 1899
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates whenever possible: Sherwood, Ontario
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc): 14 years old
9. What were your reasons for coming West?: My father had 200 acres and he wanted more land
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?): William Bredel visited my mother and she wanted us in the west. We came in 1897-98 and my father came back in the spring of 1898 and stayed most of the summer and came down from Idaho. I went to work there and then came back to the pioneer land and bought 160 acres.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was a good idea.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, or other group)? We traveled with a group of friends.

13. What means of transportation did you use? We used a horse-drawn carriage.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.) We encountered many challenges along the way, including harsh weather conditions and difficult terrain.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? We stayed at a friend's house.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? We settled near the town of Regina.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. None.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came? I worked as a farmer.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was a good idea.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, or other group)? We traveled with a group of friends.

13. What means of transportation did you use? We used a horse-drawn carriage.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.) We met friendly Indians who helped us along the way. We also encountered some difficult terrain.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? We stayed at a small town called Willow City.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? We settled in Willow City.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. None.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came? I worked as a farmer before coming to Western Canada. After coming, I continued farming.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation it as a place to settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far?
